page.title: 09The Church
page.content: There are, in fact, three churches in the D-Block - the Parish church of St. Cuthbert's, a Methodist church and a Pentecostal church. Although all three are active, the Anglican church is the largest. The main fabric of the building has been renovated and altered through the years, but the main doorway retains an excellent Norman archway. Within the church there is a small fragment of stained glass which also dates from Norman times, and is now incorporated in a more recent window. Amongst other interesting features are a Saxon muniment chest made in one piece from a section of tree-trunk, a Saxon tomb-stone and a Norman font. The belfry contains an excellent peal of bells, some dating from the seventeenth century.
